intro: Siphoneranthemum beyrichii, commonly known as the white siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Siphoneranthemum beyrichii is drought-tolerant and requires minimal care once established.
